coded_answer.p: Dear Mr Robertson.
Thank you very much for taking us to London.
This is a big opportunity to discover the capital.
ThougThoughHowever, a few of us would like to consider the "London fashion and leisure show".
This is going to take place on tuesdayTuesday marchMarch 14 atfrom 10.00 to 19.00.

Could you, if we may ask so, re-organisereorganise our visit to the museum and also to the shopping centercentre. However, none of us wishes to miss all the attractions planned in the forecastschedule.
Perhaps, we could spend our free time at the museum before going to the shopshopping centercentre.
This is a very important stay over three days. Every one hopes to enjoyingenjoy himself and comescome back with a lot of knowledge.

I thank you very much for hearing my request. I apologise for any inconvenience it couldmay makecause. I am certain you would think over about that particular visit to "the London fashion and leisure show". On behalf of all the students.,
Yours truly.,
What do famous people wishwant?
Do they want to be famous and ignored?
Or do they want to be persecuted buyby the media?
There are plenty of good things about being famous.
You do not have a precarious life.
You are rich and be-lovedbelovedloved.
Of course, it does not mean you deserve to be persecuted all the time.
Perhaps we could call it the "rough of the smooth".
However, to have hisyour photosphoto taken and showedshown on television and in the newspapers increases your popularity.
It is the way you may consider magnificent wages as it should fit your fame.
I might also missbe missing the point.
You might be a Princessprincess, a politician or a footballer; but are not doing it for any fame. You were born with the talent, sometimesometimesor with the title.
You never wished to be famous that muchsoso famous.
WhateaverWhatever you do, the journalistjournalists should not follow you every second.
Every oneEveryone deserves to be given the right ofto a private life.
